:nice, too bad it looks like there is a recursive loop

Fixed the issue with the IRCBot hanging waiting on input by sticking it into a thread.  I now have the ability to talk back and forth through telnet using the eventmachine interface; now I just need to bolt onto the convore side!
https://github.com/benzittlau/ConvoreTron
renamed the project to IRCTron given as it actually has nothing specific to convore in it
https://github.com/benzittlau/IRCTron
I also wrote a simple cinchrb plugin that read input from convore and pasted it into IRC (then I didn't have a good gem to go the other way, hence working on the convore gem).
Then these gents created a combo thingy. We've got more convore and IRC than any other group in the world!
Cool guys! Do you think you'll be able to show off something at the next meetup?
I've started working on the actual Convore Gem to flesh it out a bit (to cover the whole API). Mostly because I've never done a true open source thing.

I named mine Monitore :D Though I'm a much bigger fan of irconvore. Here's a gist of my work. The nice thing about cinchrb is that it's multi threaded and has pretty much everything I could need from an IRC bot. Each plugin is on it's own thread also. https://gist.github.com/907921
So did you guys all do slightly different implementations?
Haha, looks like it.

I have a vision of standardizing a packet format in JSON or something similar, and having a general interface.  Then it will be possible to have any number of these interfaces (for IM, Twitter, whatever you want really) and connect them as desired.
What I have thus far is basically an IRCBot with an eventmachine based socket interface.

I think cinchrb has that general idea with "plugins" (not in a JSON packet format or anything) but essentially you could load the convore plugin, twitter plugin, Facebook plugin, etc. and they would be all connected. You could create a private irc chat which monitors everything and blast it all into 1 IRC window potentially. Then you could blast out a massive response (like #fb on twitter). Essentially a pipe from IRC to the world and back. I guess you could get crafty and have any of the services barf out to the other services also.

The big difference in my design is that they are all independent agents, so you don't need to modify the codebase of any of them to add another service.  Want to add a twitter plugin?  Just start the twitter service and have it connect to the IRC or Convore bot (or both).
